derivation.yuyuan_name: early 20th cent.: from endo- 'within' + Greek krinein 'sift'

entry.def: The endocrine system is the system of glands that produce hormones which go directly into the bloodstream, such as the pituitary or thyroid glands.

means.word_mean: 1. the secretion of an endocrine gland that is transmitted by the blood to the tissue on which it has a specific effect
2. any of the glands of the endocrine system that secrete hormones directly into the bloodstream
1. of or belonging to endocrine glands or their secretions;
